Package exercise1

Class EulerSchemeWithShift

java.lang.Object
net.finmath.montecarlo.process.MonteCarloProcessFromProcessModel
net.finmath.montecarlo.process.EulerSchemeFromProcessModel
exercise1.EulerSchemeWithShift
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, net.finmath.montecarlo.process.MonteCarloProcess, net.finmath.montecarlo.process.Process
public class EulerSchemeWithShift
extends net.finmath.montecarlo.process.EulerSchemeFromProcessModel
This class implements a Weighted-Monte-Carlo Simulation for the shifted process Xh, that means a process with initalValue = initialValueOfX + h. Let X(t) be the process given by the model with has initial value initialValueOfX. We calculate an Euler-Scheme for this process. Than we add h to the initial value of this process and get the process X{o,h}. By using appropriate Monte-Carlo weights wh we assure that:
E[f(X h(t i ) )] = E[f(X{o,h})w h(t_i) )]
where t_i are the discretization points.
This class is based on EulerSchemeFromProcessModel. In difference to this class we only consider one-dimension one-factor Brownian motion and all models use an standard Euler scheme. This class is implemented for the Black-Scholes-Model and the inhomogenous and homogenous Bachelier-Model. For construction of the class we use a parameter ModelName and the model is created inside the class. To get an an MonteCarloAssetModel please use the wrapper class ShiftProcessValue to guarantee the functionality of getCloneWithModifiedData.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Nicolas Nichell & Shanfeng Huang

  • Method Details

    • createEulerSchemeWithShift

      public static EulerSchemeWithShift createEulerSchemeWithShift​(double initialValue, double riskFreeRate, double volatility, net.finmath.time.TimeDiscretization timeDiscretization, int numberOfPaths, int seed, double shiftOfSimulatedValuesAfterFirstTimeStep, EulerSchemeWithShift.ModelName modelName)
      This method returns an Euler discretization scheme with shift.
      Parameters:
      initialValue - The initial value of the process.
      riskFreeRate - The risk free rate.
      volatility - The volatility.
      timeDiscretization - The time discretization of the Euler scheme which must be >= 0 and monotone increasing.
      numberOfPaths - The number of paths.
      seed - The seed for the Monte-Carlo random number generator.
      shiftOfSimulatedValuesAfterFirstTimeStep - A shift applied to the values in the first simulation time step. The Monte-Carlo weights correct for this shift.
      modelName - The name of the model (the SDE specification) which is used to generate the stochastic process.
      Returns:
      The corresponding Euler scheme.

    • getProcessValue

    • getMonteCarloWeights

    • getCloneWithModifiedData

      public net.finmath.montecarlo.process.MonteCarloProcess getCloneWithModifiedData​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> dataModified)
      This method check for the new modified paramters and returns a class where the specified parameters are changed. There is a special behavior for initialValue: If there is an entry ("initialValue", newInitialValue) in the map it will as for the other parameters change the initalValue but in addition adapt the shift to newShift = initialValueOfX - newInitialValue. Thus the underlying process X remains the same and for t>0 also the values of \(X^h(t)\). but the Monte-Carlo-weights will be adapted.
      Specified by:
      getCloneWithModifiedData in interface net.finmath.montecarlo.process.MonteCarloProcess
      Overrides:
      getCloneWithModifiedData in class net.finmath.montecarlo.process.EulerSchemeFromProcessModel
      Parameters:
      dataModified - the map of the modified data. Possible keys in the map are: seed, stochasticDriver, initialValue, riskFreeRate, volatility.
      Returns:
      the Euler scheme with modified data.
